20110106020204.000|20110106020206.000|TR0|breaking story tonight.
20110106020206.000|20110106020207.000|TR0|
20110106020207.000|20110106020209.000|TR0|Evidence of fraud against an autism 
20110106020209.000|20110106020211.000|TR0|researcher.  This is a big deal.  His name 
20110106020211.000|20110106020212.000|TR0|is Andrew Wakefield.  He's no longer a 
20110106020212.000|20110106020214.000|TR0|practicing doctor.  His medical license 
20110106020214.000|20110106020216.000|TR0|was stripped in Britain back in May.
20110106020216.000|20110106020217.000|TR0|
20110106020217.000|20110106020219.000|TR0|In a 1998 study published in the medical 
20110106020219.000|20110106020221.000|TR0|journal "The Lancet' he claimed to have 
20110106020221.000|20110106020223.000|TR0|found a link between vaccines that kids 
20110106020223.000|20110106020224.000|TR0|take and autism.  Now in the years since, 
20110106020224.000|20110106020226.000|TR0|as autism cases have inexplicably risen, 
20110106020226.000|20110106020228.000|TR0|an increasing number of parents have 
20110106020228.000|20110106020229.000|TR0|stopped getting their kids vaccinated.
20110106020229.000|20110106020231.000|TR0|
20110106020231.000|20110106020233.000|TR0|The Wakefield study has since been 
20110106020233.000|20110106020234.000|TR0|discredited and just tonight, an 
20110106020234.000|20110106020236.000|TR0|investigative journalist published his 
20110106020236.000|20110106020238.000|TR0|findings in the "British Medical Journal," 
20110106020238.000|20110106020240.000|TR0|"BMJ" calling the Wakefield study, quote, 
20110106020240.000|20110106020241.000|TR0|"an elaborate fraud."  A fraud that has 
20110106020241.000|20110106020243.000|TR0|done long-lasting damage to kid's health.
20110106020243.000|20110106020245.000|TR0|
20110106020245.000|20110106020246.000|TR0|Now, BMJ, this journal, says that 
20110106020246.000|20110106020248.000|TR0|Wakefield faked the data on the 12 kids 
20110106020248.000|20110106020250.000|TR0|who were the focus of the 1998 study.  Not 
20110106020250.000|20110106020251.000|TR0|just made a mistake.  They show evidence 
20110106020251.000|20110106020253.000|TR0|that he faked it and that he had financial 
20110106020253.000|20110106020255.000|TR0|motives for doing so.
20110106020255.000|20110106020257.000|TR0|

20110106024933.000|20110106024935.000|TR0|Florida.  And in that much time, you're in 
20110106024935.000|20110106024937.000|TR0|a country surrounded by people who have 
20110106024937.000|20110106024938.000|TR0|had absolutely no experience or dependence 
20110106024938.000|20110106024940.000|TR0|on comfort in their entire experience, in 
20110106024940.000|20110106024942.000|TR0|the experience of their parents, in the 
20110106024942.000|20110106024943.000|TR0|experience of their grandparents.
20110106024943.000|20110106024945.000|TR0|
20110106024945.000|20110106024947.000|TR0|And the lessons of that is -- you know, I 
20110106024947.000|20110106024948.000|TR0|don't mean to talk about it in a kind of 
20110106024948.000|20110106024950.000|TR0|highfalutin way, but it's something that I 
20110106024950.000|20110106024952.000|TR0|think is such a -- it's nutrition for 
20110106024952.000|20110106024954.000|TR0|anyone that grew up in a situation where 
20110106024954.000|20110106024955.000|TR0|if all you had available was the thought
